Typst validation

Source: vignettes/typst-validation.qmd

r2typ does not do any kind validation and will accept any arguments you’re passing to it.

For example, in Typst the #linebreak() function only accepts a justify: bool argument, but in r2typ you can do:

library(r2typ)

linebreak()
#> [1] "#linebreak()"
linebreak(justify = TRUE)
#> [1] "#linebreak(justify: true)"
linebreak(any_other_args = TRUE) # this works!
#> [1] "#linebreak(any_other_args: true)"

It’s considered to be the job of the user to make sure the arguments they use make sense. The main reason for this is to reduce (a lot) maintenance cost and make r2typ more easily up to date with new Typst versions in the future.

If you want to make sure that your Typst is valid, you can use the is_valid_typst() function:

library(r2typ)

linebreak() |> is_valid_typst()
#> [1] TRUE
linebreak(justify = TRUE) |> is_valid_typst()
#> [1] TRUE
linebreak(any_other_args = TRUE) |> is_valid_typst()
#> [1] FALSE
